Section 3: Safety Precautions
content.warning: Do not ride the bicycle until the grips have completely dried and are securely in place. Wet grips can cause your hands to slip, leading to loss of control.
Never ride a bicycle without grips installed on the handlebar.
content.caution: Ensure the handlebar is correctly aligned in the center of the stem before tightening the clamp bolt.
content.heading: Section 4: Procedure Steps
Subsection 4.1: Step 1: Handlebar Installation
content.item: Insert the handlebar into the stem.
Tighten the stem clamp bolt, ensuring the handlebar is centered.
content.heading: Subsection 4.2: Step 2: Lever Installation
content.item: Install the brake lever and shifter lever onto the handlebar.
Re-position the shifter lever, ensuring cables are not pinched.
Tighten the clamp bolts for both levers.
content.heading: Subsection 4.3: Step 3: Grip Installation
content.item: Apply hairspray to the area where the grips will be installed.
Position the grips and quickly move them into the correct position before the hairspray dries.
Ensure the grip protects the end of the handlebar or install a handlebar plug.
content.heading: Section 5: Post Installation Checks
content.item: Verify all bolts are securely tightened.
Confirm the handlebar is aligned correctly and does not move.
Visually inspect the installation to ensure all components are properly installed.
content.heading: Section 6: Closing Remarks
content.para: This procedure provides a comprehensive guide for installing a handlebar. Following these steps and adhering to the safety precautions will ensure a secure and reliable installation.
